chapters.title: The Legacy of Thorns
chapters.summary: Lyra struggles through her final exams at Arcanum Finis, her cursed heritage making her an outcast. The first petrification occurs, sending the academy into panic.
key_events: Lyra fails a practical spellcasting exam, her magic 'stuttering'.
She is mocked by peers, including descendants of heroes like Valerius (Prince Charming's line).
Headmistress Grimm announces a student from the Snow White line has been found completely petrified mid-enchantment.
Lyra experiences a strange, slow-motion vision as she touches the petrified statue.
Her great-aunt, the last living Sleeper, sends a cryptic warning: 'It's waking.'
chapters.ending_hook: Lyra discovers her own fingertips have turned to grey, unfeeling stone.

chapters.title: The Clockwork Heart
chapters.summary: Lyra hides her petrification while being assigned to a research team with her rival, Valerius, to investigate the blight.
key_events: Lyra covers her stony fingers with gloves.
Headmistress Grimm pairs pragmatic Valerius with Lyra, hoping her 'unique perspective' might help.
They investigate the petrified student's workshop, finding a half-woven spell of preservation.
Lyra's time-sense triggers, allowing her to see ghostly echoes of the moment of petrification.
They discover a residue of magic unlike any known lineage—a cold, still energy.
chapters.ending_hook: Valerius finds a single, twisted spindle thorn in the victim's locked drawer.

chapters.title: Waking Dreams
chapters.summary: Lyra's nightmares intensify, pulling her into the past. She seeks forbidden knowledge in the Restricted Stacks.
key_events: Lyra dreams of the original spinning wheel and feels a malevolent presence within the curse.
She confides in the academy's archivist, a descendant of the Frog Prince.
In the Restricted Stacks, she finds a suppressed history: the Sleeping Curse was not mere malice, but a corrupted form of Chronomancy—time magic.
She learns the original princess didn't just sleep; she was trapped in a single moment.
Her own petrification spreads to her wrist.
chapters.ending_hook: A hidden text whispers to her: 'The Sleeper must become the Spindle to control the Thread.'

chapters.title: Fractured Alliance
chapters.summary: A second petrification reveals the blight is spreading. Lyra and Valerius form a tense alliance with other 'cursed' descendants.
key_events: A descendant of the Beast is petrified in the library.
Valerius defends Lyra from accusations, forcing them to trust each other.
They recruit others with 'bad' legacies: a descendant of the Wicked Witch, and one from Rumpelstiltskin.
The group deduces the blight targets those using high levels of inherited magic.
Lyra experiments, discovering she can briefly 'still' a falling object—her first conscious use of time magic.
chapters.ending_hook: The group is caught by Headmistress Grimm, who confiscates their research, calling it 'dangerous obsession.'

chapters.title: The Gilded Cage
chapters.summary: Confined to quarters, Lyra is visited by the ghost of her ancestor, who offers cryptic guidance. Valerius uncovers a cover-up.
key_events: Lyra's dream-walking becomes a conscious trance; she speaks to the spectral form of the original Sleeping Beauty.
The ancestor reveals the curse was a weapon meant to 'still' a great evil, but it backfired.
Valerius breaks into Grimm's office, finding records of similar petrification events centuries ago, all purged from history.
He finds a list of current students, with certain lineages marked for 'observation.'
Lyra's ancestor warns: 'The Spindle seeks an Heir to complete its work.'
chapters.ending_hook: Lyra wakes to find her entire arm petrified, but now she can feel the flow of time around it like a tangible web.

chapters.title: The Midnight Garden
chapters.summary: The group escapes confinement to find the source of the spindle thorns—a hidden, blighted garden within the academy grounds.
key_events: Using Lyra's growing time-sense, they slip past guards by creating momentary 'lags' in perception.
They discover a walled garden overgrown with metallic, thorned vines that pulse with slow magic.
At the center is a petrified, ancient tree shaped like a spinning wheel.
The garden is a locus of the still magic; time moves fractionally slower inside.
They are attacked by animated thorn creatures, forcing Lyra to fully 'still' one—exhausting her but proving her power.
chapters.ending_hook: Valerius is scratched by a thorn. His hand begins to turn grey, and his heroic magic falters.

chapters.title: The Unhero's Choice
chapters.summary: With Valerius infected, the group is divided. Lyra must delve deeper into her cursed magic to find a cure, confronting her destiny.
key_events: Valerius's condition weakens his lineage's innate 'charm' magic, making him see his legacy as a prison.
Lyra uses her time-sense to examine the thorn's magic, seeing it as a virus that seeks out active magical bloodlines.
She theorizes the original curse was a vaccine gone wrong, or a weapon turned inward.
To find an antidote, she must willingly enter a full waking sleep—a trance of absolute stillness.
In the trance, she sees the true enemy: not a person, but a sentient, hungry 'Stillness' that feeds on magical action.
chapters.ending_hook: Lyra awakens from the trance, but her eyes are now fully grey and stone-like. She knows how to slow Valerius's petrification, but not stop it.

chapters.title: Grimm's Truth
chapters.summary: Confronted by the group, Headmistress Grimm reveals the terrible bargain that maintains the magical world, and her role in the crisis.
key_events: The group confronts Grimm with their evidence.
Grimm confesses: the academy isn't just a school, but a seal. The 'Stillness' is the entropy at the end of all fairy tales.
The petrifications are a symptom of the seal weakening. The marked students are potential anchors for a new, more terrible seal.
Lyra's lineage is the original anchor—the Spindle that pinned the Stillness in place.
Grimm has been trying to find a way to reinforce the seal without sacrificing another student, but is failing.
chapters.ending_hook: A massive petrification wave hits the academy during the confrontation, trapping Headmistress Grimm in stone mid-sentence.

chapters.title: The Weaving of Time
chapters.summary: With the academy in chaos, Lyra must learn to weave time, not just still it, to protect her friends and reverse minor petrifications.
key_events: Lyra, Valerius, and their group become leaders for the terrified student body.
Lyra practices her magic, learning to create 'bubbles' of slowed time as shields.
She successfully reverses the petrification of a small animal, but it costs her greatly, spreading the stone on her own body.
She understands she must become the new Spindle—a permanent anchor—to re-seal the Stillness.
Valerius, weakened but determined, refuses to let her sacrifice herself.
chapters.ending_hook: The ancient thorn-tree in the hidden garden blooms with a single, radiant rose—a sign the final confrontation is near.

chapters.title: Crown of Thorns
chapters.summary: The Stillness manifests as a terrifying, silent entity in the heart of the academy. Lyra leads a desperate defense.
key_events: The Stillness coalesces into a formless, grey wave that petrifies everything in its path.
Students of all lineages unite, using their magic not to attack, but to create a dazzling, chaotic tapestry of change and story—the opposite of stillness.
Lyra weaves a complex time-field, slowing the wave's advance.
Valerius, using his fading charm magic, does not command hope, but inspires it, giving Lyra more power.
Lyra realizes she cannot just re-seal the Stillness; she must absorb and transform it using her cursed blood as a filter.
chapters.ending_hook: Lyra walks into the heart of the Stillness, her body turning completely to stone as she embraces it.

chapters.title: The Eternal Moment
chapters.summary: Trapped within the perfect stillness of her own curse, Lyra battles the entity's consciousness and unravels the original spell's purpose.
key_events: Lyra's consciousness exists in a frozen instant, facing the hunger of the Stillness.
She sees the truth: the first Sleeper was meant to be a guardian, a repository for this entropy, but was unprepared.
Lyra, trained and willing, chooses not to sleep, but to hold. She becomes a living dam, not a victim.
She begins to process the Stillness, transforming it from entropy into potential—raw, unmade time.
Her petrified form in the real world begins to glow from within.
chapters.ending_hook: In the real world, a crack appears on Lyra's stone cheek.

chapters.title: A New Legacy
chapters.summary: Lyra emerges transformed, having turned the curse into a gift. The academy and the magical world must change its view of 'cursed' legacies.
key_events: Lyra shatters her stone shell, now with control over time—able to slow, hasten, and glimpse threads of possibility.
The petrified students and Headmistress Grimm are restored.
The hidden garden blooms with normal, vibrant flowers; the thorn-tree is now a healthy oak.
Lyra and Valerius, his own magic changed by the ordeal, reforge the academy's purpose: to understand all magic, not just the 'heroic.'
Lyra is no longer the heir to a curse, but the Spindle's Heir—a weaver of time and a new kind of guardian.
chapters.ending_hook: As Lyra looks out at the recovering academy, she feels a distant, familiar pull of stillness elsewhere in the world—a hint that her work, and the next story, has just begun.
